metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4244 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - high
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's netfilter: nf_tablescomponent can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. Due to arace condition between nf_tables netlink control plane transaction andnft_set element garbage collection, it is possible to underflow thereference counter causing a use-after-free vulnerability. We recommendupgrading past commit 3e91b0ebd994635df2346353322ac51ce84ce6d8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4244` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-35-generic - 6.2.0-35.35
linux-image-6.2.0-35-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-35.35
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-35-generic - 6.2.0-35.35
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-35-generic-64k - 6.2.0-35.35
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1015-kvm - 6.2.0-1015.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1014-aws - 6.2.0-1014.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1015-azure - 6.2.0-1015.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1017-gcp - 6.2.0-1017.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1015-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1015.15
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1015-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1015.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1014-oracle - 6.2.0-1014.14
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1015-raspi - 6.2.0-1015.17
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1007-starfive - 6.2.0-1007.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-35.35').
linux-kvm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1015.15').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-aws package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1014.14').
linux-azure package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1015.15').
linux-gcp package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1017.19').
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needs-triage').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1015.15').
linux-oracle package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1014.14').
linux-raspi package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1015.17').
linux-starfive package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1007.8').
